name: pnp-graph-connector-powershell-json-ignite
title: Ingest local json content using PowerShell with Ignite sessions
shortDescription: This sample contains a Copilot connector built in PowerShell that shows how to ingest local json content. Each session is a row of data, mapped to external connection's schema and using the metadata from the JSON file. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.
longDescription: This sample contains a Copilot connector built in PowerShell that shows how to ingest local json content. Each session is a row of data, mapped to external connection's schema and using the metadata from the JSON file. The ingested content is set to be visible to everyone in the organization.

thumbnails.alt: External content displayed in Microsoft Search search results, visualized using a custom Adaptive Card

references.name: Copilot connectors overview
references.description: Learn more what Copilot connectors are and when you'd use them.

references.name: Build your first custom Copilot connector
references.description: Learn how to build your first custom Copilot connector using .NET.
